title: Crew Travel Authority
summary: This page provides full details about the Crew Travel Authority (CTA), an electronic immigration record that allows international airline crew, positioning crew, and aircraft safety inspectors to enter Australia. It explains eligibility, conditions of stay, obligations, costs, and the step‑by‑step process for registration.

structured_data.description: An electronic immigration record for international airline crew, airline positioning crew, and aircraft safety inspectors who travel to and from Australia as part of their work.

validity.registration_validity: Valid for the life of the passport based on the passport expiry date
validity.digital_link: Digitally linked to passport; no visa label provided

who_does_not_need_cta: Crew members with New Zealand passports

general_requirements: Must be registered as crew by your air carrier
Must be travelling on an eligible international airline flight (commercial passenger, chartered passenger, freight or cargo)

requirements: Employed by an international air carrier as aircrew
Travels to Australia as part of job as aircrew
Will leave Australia by air as part of job or as a passenger
Employed by an international air carrier as aircrew
Travels to Australia as a passenger as part of job
Employed by a foreign government to inspect international air carriers or aircraft safety
Travels to Australia by air as part of job
Will leave Australia by air as part of job or as a passenger
accepted_identity_documents: Valid government identity document showing employment by a foreign government

eligibility.private_flight_restrictions: Private flight operators cannot register for or use a CTA; flight must be commercial or chartered carrying passengers or cargo.

allowed_activities: Travel to Australia as part of work as international airline crew or safety inspector
Stay in Australia for permitted duration based on crew role
Arrive as passenger when acting as airline positioning crew
Enter Australia as an aircraft safety inspector with valid identity documentation

stay_conditions.special_purpose_visa_note: All CTA entrants are granted a Special Purpose visa upon arrival
stay_conditions.stay_extension: You must apply for another visa if you want to stay longer; cannot extend Special Purpose visa

new_zealand_passport_holders.cta_requirement: NZ passport holders do not need a CTA
staying_longer_instructions: Do not enter via SmartGate if needing to stay longer than CTA periods
Apply for Special Category Visa (SCV subclass 444)
scv_rights: Live, work, visit and study in Australia
SCV ends upon leaving Australia; must apply again upon next arrival
new_zealand_passport_holders.potential_impacts: Entering on a Special Purpose visa instead of SCV may affect social security residency status

cannot: Use CTA to travel as a passenger to Australia unless an airline positioning crew member
Work more than one domestic leg in Australia unless it is part of an international arrival or departure

travel_conditions.multiple_entry: Unlimited travel outside and return to Australia while CTA is valid
travel_conditions.time_outside_australia: Does not extend duration of CTA

visa_label.details: Visa is digitally linked to passport

how_to_apply.registration_process: Air carriers typically register crew members for CTAs

steps.title: Before you apply
details: Renew passport before carrier registers for CTA
CTA is linked to passport; must use same passport to travel

steps.title: Gather your documents
documents_needed: Valid Airline Identity Card or ICAO Safety Inspector Certificate

aircraft_safety_inspectors: Granted Special Purpose visa for 30 days from disembarkation
Must hold valid government identity document or ICAO certificate
Must be included in crew list provided by or for the carrier
special_rules.air_crew_documents: Airline crew members granted Special Purpose visa for 30 days (content truncated)
